question_text: Why would a Windows PC with an APIPA address report 'Limited or No Connectivity'?
answer_options: The APIPA IP is not valid for Ethernet
The device can only access the internet at reduced speed
The system detects no default gateway is present
The ARP table was flushed by DHCP
correct_answer: The system detects no default gateway is present
explanation: Windows uses this warning when an APIPA address is assigned, indicating the device cannot access external networks.
